title: Synthetic Recap
body:
ORLANDO – History was not just made, it was detonated. In a dominant 111-87 victory over the Indiana Pacers, the Orlando Magic did not merely win a game; they provided the stage for a seismic, record-shattering performance from Shaquille O’Neal that will echo through the annals of the league.

O’Neal was not a player; he was a force of nature. He poured in a staggering 41 points, but the sheer volume of his scoring was only half the story. The 7-foot-1 center was an unstoppable engine of efficiency, connecting on a phenomenal 17 of his 21 attempts from the field. He was a whirlwind of power and precision, dismantling the Pacers’ defense at will.

While Shaq authored the masterpiece, his supporting cast provided the perfect frame. Penny Hardaway, the other half of Orlando’s superstar duo, orchestrated the offense with a brilliant 14 assists, feeding the beast in the paint time and again. Dennis Scott provided the necessary floor-spacing, knocking down critical shots.

The Pacers, led by Reggie Miller’s 18 points, simply had no answer. Any attempt to mount a challenge was met with another thunderous O’Neal dunk or a feathery hook shot in the lane. The Magic’s defense, anchored by their colossal center, held Indiana to a paltry 87 points, suffocating their offensive flow.

The final buzzer signaled more than just a 24-point rout; it signaled a historic night. On this evening, Shaquille O’Neal transcended the sport, delivering a performance of such raw, overwhelming power that it cemented his legacy as one of the most dominant forces the game has ever seen. The Magic didn’t just win; they witnessed a legend being written in real time.
